wikipedia_page.main: Robert Nicholas Johnson (born 30 March 1962) is an English retired professional footballer who played in the Football League for Brentford as a left back.

response: After many failed attempts, Brentford manager Fred Callaghan finally signed what would prove to be a potent strike partnership during the 1982 off-season – Francis Joseph from Wimbledon and Tony Mahoney from Fulham.White, p. 318-320. Goalkeeper David McKellar's contract was terminated after a serious breach of club discipline and he was replaced by former Chelsea goalkeeper Petar Borota, though Barota would only appear in three Football League Group Cup fixtures before being in turn replaced by Paddy Roche. The defensive ranks were cleared out, with Pat Kruse, Mark Hill, Robbie Johnson, Paul Shrubb and Kevin Teer all released.Croxford, Lane & Waterman, p. 65. Experienced former Chelsea defender Graham Wilkins arrived on a free transfer.
